TopicTitle: A small and hopefully simple suggestion/request

Articles.Content: How about adding a audio mute key or button? This would be great--for example--if I'm alt-tabbing to a browser to check out a YouTube video tutorial or other site where I may need to listen to what the individual is saying before returning and un-muting the game. That could also be great if you need to take a moment to listen to your significant other, parent, ... is saying to you while you have the game running.

That would be useful to have.

And I see you only have a few posts, so welcome to the forum.
Thanks! It just occurred to me after trying to follow along with Scott Manley's Career Mode tutorial.
Or for that matter, what about just automatically muting the sound when the game's not in the foreground?
Why they haven't integrated a YouTube player into the game yet, I'll never know.
Muting the game when it's not in the foreground is another good idea, but a mute would still be useful for other reasons.
Leaving game audio on in background can be useful, if you have sound turned on for Kerbal alarm clock.
I always pause and shift+tab to the steam browser, works just fine for me.
